programmes.show_description: An archive celebration of Tom Jones's performances at the BBC from the start of his pop career in the mid-60s to Later... with Jools Holland in 2010 and all points in between.
The Manics return to St David's Hall Cardiff, scene of their earliest busking gigs, this time playing from a 35-year back catalogue. Part of Radio 2 Live 2021 across UK music venues.
Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 30 April 1999 and featuring Martine McCutcheon, Texas, Busta Rhymes, Faithless and Westlife.
Kate Thornton presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 7 May 1999 and featuring Phats & Small, The Offspring, Fun Lovin' Criminals, Cast, Geri Halliwell and Westlife.
Mike Read presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 March 1979 and featuring The Skids, Thin Lizzy, Chic and David Essex. With dance sequences by Legs & Co.
Programmes start at 7.00pm.

...Survival - Wildlife on One. David Attenborough looks at how ostriches have developed bizarre survival strategies, from flamboyant sex to kidnapping.
6/6. Julian Richards joins archaeologists in a farmer's field in Cheshire as they excavate a long-lost chapel and the undisturbed burials of medieval landowners.
Leonard Sachs presents the old-time music hall show from the City Varieties Music Hall. With Ken Dodd, Lyn Kennington, the Jan Hunt Panto and performers from the Players' Theatre.

Michael Parkinson in conversation with Kenneth Allsop, Lauren Bacall and Tom Paxton. First transmitted in 1972.
8/8. Classic sitcom. MPs have been complaining about their phones being tapped. Jim Hacker naturally denies this, only to be told by Sir Humphrey that it is in fact true.
2/6. Sitcom. Hyacinth has asked the new vicar to tea, and - in her usual meticulous way - she has organised the event down to the last sugar lump. Events take a sudden turn.
3/5. It's a scorcher as Gareth Edwards and wife Maureen get to the seaside resort of Llandudno.

1/6. Dan Cruickshank looks at the architecture of Norfolk with the help of Nikolaus Pevsner's architectural guide.
How thousands of strange nocturnal birds make their home on the island of Bardsey in north Wales, and an exploration of the history of the island itself.
Celebrating great music making across Europe, a special concert marking Finnish Independence Day from Helsinki, also featuring music by Saariaho and Klami.

programmes.show_name: British History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programmes.show_description: 3/3. Lucy explores how British history is a concoction of fibs. She debunks the fibs that surround the 'jewel in the crown' of the British Empire - India.

programmes.show_name: Making of Lord of the Flies
programmes.show_description: Monsoon weather, remote locations and raw performances feed this hypnotic adaptation. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programmes.show_name: Ibsen: The Lady from the Sea (1953)
programmes.show_description: A lighthouse-keeper's daughter is trapped in her marriage and longs for the sea. From 1953.
